tournament.name: Free Japan Championship 2021 SEASON1 Special Weekly Challenge

decks.notes: This aggressive deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and efficient creature base, backed up by powerful combat tricks and removal spells. Key cards like Bonecrusher Giant and Lovestruck Beast provide early pressure, while Goldspan Dragon and Showdown of the Skalds generate additional advantage and close out games quickly. The deck's mana base is designed for consistency, with a mix of pathways and Fabled Passage to ensure the right colors are available when needed. The goal is to establish a strong board presence and push through damage before the opponent can stabilize.

This Naya Aggro deck focuses on quickly playing creatures like Bonecrusher Giant, Lovestruck Beast, and Goldspan Dragon to pressure the opponent, while utilizing cards like Showdown of the Skalds to generate extra value. Shepherd of the Flock helps protect important creatures, while Giant Killer provides removal options. The deck also includes ways to give creatures extra power with cards like Unleash Fury and Kazuul's Fury. The mana base is streamlined with pathways and Fabled Passage to ensure smooth mana development. This deck aims to win the game quickly through aggressive creature plays and combat tricks.

The key concept of this deck is to establish early board dominance and apply constant pressure to the opponent. It utilizes a mix of powerful creatures with high damage output, such as Goldspan Dragon, Questing Beast, and Brushfire Elemental. The deck also includes cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and The Great Henge to maintain card advantage and generate value. Embercleave is used as a finisher to deliver a devastating blow to the opponent. The deck aims to quickly establish a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive strategy.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays and leveraging the powerful abilities of Naya colored creatures and spells. It aims to put pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Giant Killer, Lovestruck Beast, and Goldspan Dragon, while utilizing cards like Showdown of the Skalds and Unleash Fury to pump up their creatures and deal quick damage. The deck also includes protection spells like Sejiri Shelter and versatile removal options like Bonecrusher Giant to maintain board advantage and push for victory. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the aggressive strategy and maximize consistency.

The key concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to apply constant pressure on the opponent by efficiently utilizing a combination of creature removal, card draw, and versatile threats. The deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy through cards like Heartless Act, Murderous Rider, and Vorinclex, Monstrous Raider. Additionally, the deck generates card advantage and resilience through Edgewall Innkeeper and Vivien, Monsters' Advocate. With a mix of strong creatures like Lovestruck Beast and Valki, God of Lies, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total.

The focus of this Naya Aggro deck is to quickly put pressure on the opponent by utilizing efficient creatures like Goldspan Dragon, Bonecrusher Giant, and Lovestruck Beast. The deck also includes spells like Unleash Fury and Kazuul's Fury to increase the damage output of the creatures. Showdown of the Skalds helps refill the hand and maintain momentum. The mana base includes pathways for flexibility and consistent mana sources. Overall, the deck aims to swarm the board with threats and overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize.

This deck focuses on consistently putting pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Lovestruck Beast and Goldspan Dragon, while also utilizing powerful spells like Unleash Fury and Kazuul's Fury to deal massive bursts of damage. The deck also includes utility creatures like Shepherd of the Flock and Giant Killer to control the board and protect key threats. Showdown of the Skalds provides card advantage and pumps up the team, ensuring a steady stream of threats to overwhelm the opponent. The mana base is optimized for consistent access to all three colors of mana.

The deck focuses on maximizing damage output and aggression by utilizing creatures with powerful abilities and instant spells to disrupt opponents. The key concept is to quickly build a board presence with cards like Bonecrusher Giant and Lovestruck Beast, while also having access to powerful finishers like Goldspan Dragon. The inclusion of Alrund's Epiphany and The Great Henge provides additional value and card advantage to maintain momentum in the game. Additionally, the companion Obosh, the Preypiercer enhances the deck's damage potential by modifying the casting cost of the cards in the deck.

The deck focuses on quickly building up a board presence with aggressive creatures like Shepherd of the Flock, Bonecrusher Giant, and Goldspan Dragon. Edgewall Innkeeper and Lovestruck Beast help generate card advantage and create additional threats. Giant Killer provides removal against larger threats, while Sejiri Shelter offers protection for key creatures. Unleash Fury and Kazuul's Fury can pump up creatures for surprise attacks or finish off opponents. Showdown of the Skalds can provide card advantage and help close out games. The deck utilizes a balanced mana base to support its aggressive game plan.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Lovestruck Beast and Goldspan Dragon to quickly overwhelm the opponent. Cards like Showdown of the Skalds and Edgewall Innkeeper help generate card advantage and fuel the aggro strategy. Shepherd of the Flock and Giant Killer provide flexibility in dealing with opposing threats. The deck also includes some removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Fire Prophecy to control the board. With a mana base that includes pathways and Fabled Passage for fixing, the deck aims to curve out efficiently and apply constant pressure on the opponent.

The main idea of this Red Deck Wins aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with quick, aggressive creatures like Robber of the Rich, Fervent Champion, and Dragonkin Berserker. With strong support from Torbran and Goldspan Dragon, the deck aims to deal quick damage to the opponent while controlling the board with removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Roil Eruption. Utilizing snow-covered mountains for Faceless Haven and Frost Bite, this deck is optimized for fast and efficient aggression to secure a victory before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of removal spells, counterspells, card draw, and powerful threat cards. It aims to establish board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up for a powerful late-game with cards like Emergent Ultimatum and Alrund's Epiphany. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for extra value by flickering permanents for additional effects. The deck also focuses on ramping up mana with cards like Cultivate and Wolfwillow Haven to cast its high-cost spells efficiently.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through various removal spells and counterspells, while also ramping up mana with cards like Cultivate and Wolfwillow Haven. The goal is to reach the late game where you can cast powerful spells like emergent ultimatum and kiora bests the sea god to take over the game. Additionally, the companion Yorion, Sky Nomad provides additional value by flickering permanents for extra triggers. The deck aims to outvalue opponents with its versatile mix of removal, card draw, and big threats.

The focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with small, cheap creatures that can quickly build up a strong board presence. By utilizing cards like Usher of the Fallen and Luminarch Aspirant, this deck aims to flood the board with creatures and use equipment like Maul of the Skyclaves to enhance their effectiveness in combat. Additionally, cards like Skyclave Apparition provide removal options to control the opponent's board while maintaining pressure. The goal is to establish dominance in the early game and maintain it throughout the match.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with low-cost aggressive creatures and powerful auras to boost them. By using efficient creatures like Usher of the Fallen and Luminarch Aspirant, along with equipment like Maul of the Skyclaves, the deck aims to build a strong board presence early on and apply pressure to the opponent. Cards like Selfless Savior also provide protection for key creatures, allowing for sustained aggression. The inclusion of Snow-Covered Plains and Faceless Haven provide additional utility and resilience in the deck.
